headline.print_headline: Britain: Officials May Take Custody of Extremely Overweight Boy
headline.main: Britain: Officials May Take Custody of Extremely Overweight Boy

docs.lead_paragraph: The authorities are considering taking an 8-year-old boy who weighs 218 pounds into protective custody unless his mother improves his diet. Social services officials will meet with family members today to discuss the health of the boy, Connor McCreaddie, at left with his mother, Nicola McKeown. A spokeswoman for health officials in Wallsend, north of London, said the hearing was part of a process that could eventually lead to Connor, who lives with his mother and sister and weighs more than three times the average for his age, being taken into protective care. The agencies organizing the meeting said they “have been working with the family over a prolonged period of time.” Connor’s case attracted national attention after his mother allowed ITV television to film his day-to-day life over of a month. He eats double or triple what another boy would, she told ITV. “If I didn’t give him enough at teatime, then he would just go on at us all night for snacks and stuff,” she said.
docs.snippet: The authorities are considering taking an 8-year-old boy who weighs 218 pounds into protective custody unless his mother improves his diet. Social services officials will meet with family members today to discuss the health of the boy, Connor...

headline.print_headline: You Want Some Truth With That?
headline.main: You Want Some Truth With That?

docs.lead_paragraph: New York’s effort to compel fast-food restaurants to list calories alongside menu prices is essential to helping people make healthful decisions.
docs.snippet: New York’s effort to compel fast-food restaurants to list calories alongside menu prices is essential to helping people make healthful decisions.

headline.print_headline: City Council May Rewrite Calorie Rules
headline.main: City Council May Change Menu Rule on Calories

docs.lead_paragraph: The City Council may soon consider a bill overturning a rule by the New York City Board of Health requiring calorie information to be displayed at fast-food and chain outlets.
docs.snippet: The City Council may soon consider a bill overturning a rule by the New York City Board of Health requiring calorie information to be displayed at fast-food and chain outlets.

headline.print_headline: Campbell Moses Jr., 89; Linked Doctors Through TV
headline.main: Campbell Moses Jr., 89, Who Linked Doctors Through TV, Dies

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Campbell Moses Jr. was an internist and a former medical director of the American Heart Association who in the 1950s and ’60s made innovative educational television programs intended for fellow physicians.
docs.snippet: Dr. Campbell Moses Jr. was an internist and a former medical director of the American Heart Association who in the 1950s and ’60s made innovative educational television programs intended for fellow physicians.
